verses.text: So king Solomon was king over all Israel.
And these \add were\add* the princes which he had; Azariah the son of Zadok the priest,
Elihoreph and Ahiah, the sons of Shisha, scribes; Jehosaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder.
And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada \add was\add* over the army: and Zadok and Abiathar \add were\add* the priests:
And Azariah the son of Nathan \add was\add* over the officers: and Zabud the son of Nathan \add was\add* principal officer, \add and\add* the king's friend:
And Ahishar \add was\add* over the household: and Adoniram the son of Abda \add was\add* over the tribute.
And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and his household: each man his month in a year made provision.
And these \add are\add* their names: The son of Hur, in mount Ephraim:
The son of Dekar, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan:
The son of Hesed, in Aruboth; to him \add pertained\add* Sochoh, and all the land of Hepher:
The son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; who had Taphath the daughter of Solomon for a wife:

Baana the son of Ahilud; \add to him pertained\add* Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean, which \add is\add* by Zartanah beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, \add even\add* to \add the place that is\add* beyond Jokneam:

The son of Geber, in Ramoth-gilead; to him \add pertained\add* the towns of Jair the son of Manasseh, which \add are\add* in Gilead; to him \add also pertained\add* the region of Argob, which \add is\add* in Bashan, sixty great cities with walls and brazen bars:
Ahinadab the son of Iddo \add had\add* Mahanaim:
Ahimaaz \add was\add* in Naphtali; he also took Basmath the daughter of Solomon for a wife:
Baanah the son of Hushai \add was\add* in Asher and in Aloth:
Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar:
Shimei the son of Elah, in Benjamin:

Geber the son of Uri \add was\add* in the country of Gilead, \add in\add* the country of Sihon king of the Amorites, and of Og king of Bashan; and \add he was\add* the only officer who \add was\add* in the land.
Judah and Israel \add were\add* many, as the sand which \add is\add* by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking, and making merry.
And Solomon reigned over all kingdoms from the river to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt: they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and sixty measures of meal.
Ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, besides harts, and roebucks, and fallow-deer, and fatted fowls.
For he had dominion over all \add the region\add* on this side the river, from Tiphsah even to Azzah, over all the kings on this side of the river: and he had peace on all sides around him.
And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig-tree, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.
And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
And those officers provided victuals for king Solomon, and for all that came to king Solomon's table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.
Barley also and straw for the horses and dromedaries they brought to the place where \add the officers\add* were, every man according to his charge.
And God gave Solomon great wisdom and understanding, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that \add is\add* on the sea-shore.
And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
For he was wiser than all men; than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Chalcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol: and his fame was in all the surrounding nations.
And he spoke three thousand proverbs: and his songs were a thousand and five.

And he spoke of trees, from the cedar tree that \add is\add* in Lebanon even to the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spoke also of beasts, and of fowls, and of creeping animals, and of fishes.
And there came of all people to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
